meanings.definition: A long, detailed, and complicated story or account.
meanings.sent1: The teacher told us a megillah about her adventurous trip to the jungle.
meanings.sent2: I don't have time to listen to your whole megillah about what happened at the party.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa always makes his fishing trips sound like a megillah with all the details he adds.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation of the math problem was such a megillah that it took me hours to understand.
meanings.sent5: The history book was a megillah of events that shaped the world we live in today.

meanings.definition: A scroll, especially one containing the biblical book of Esther.
meanings.sent1: During Purim, we read the megillah of Esther at the synagogue.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi unrolled the megillah to read the story of Queen Esther.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped the megillah, and it rolled down the stairs like a slinky.
meanings.sent4: The megillah of Esther unfolded before our eyes, revealing the bravery of the queen.
meanings.sent5: The intricate designs on the megillah made it a beautiful piece of art.
